dialogue.string: 4�It all began with a stone, or so the legend says.
1�In ages past, a sentient jewel, enormous and beautiful, banished the darkness. Its many-colored light filled the world with life and brought forth mighty gods.
1�Bathed in that light, the world entered an age of bliss until, after a time, the gods fell into slumber. That world was called Vana'diel.
1�The legend goes on to say...From the darkest depths of the earth the Warriors of the Crystal rose...
1�The great bane will devour the fair land of Vana'diel.
1�The ancient seal will be broken, awakening nightmares of ages past.
1�The blood of innocents will soak the earth, and the world will fall into fear and despair.
1�But as one bright star shines through the clouds at night...
1�And as one song rings clear above the roar of beasts...
1�We hold to one hope in these darkest of times.
4�That they will come, with the wisdom of ages and the strength of thousands, to deliver us from our plight.
1�We await the awakening of the Warriors of the Crystal.
1�Open the door?Yes.No.
1�Open the door?Yes.No.
1�Open the door?Yes.No.
1�Open the door?Yes.No.
1�Open the door?Yes.No.
4�Arrrg, welcome t'Norg.I'm Gilgamesh, the leader of these scallywags. Me daughter's filled me in on your tale.
1�I've had me suspicions about Jeuno fer years. That's why I had Lion investigatin' these past months.
1�But blimey! I had no idear that the Archduke and his wee brother were Zilarrrt.
1�That ancient civilization perished so long ago, there be no record of it.
1�And who be these five Warriors of the Crystal?
1�I don't know nothin' 'bout no Crystal Warriors or ancient legends, but I do know I'm not gonna sit around waitin' fer these Zilart to take over the world.
1�??Cleanse the world??? ??Beginning of the end??? That be a lot of fancy talk.
1�But let's see them say that in front of yours truly! I'm not runnin' away from no fight!
1�We're settin' out fer the Temple of Uggalepih.
1�Arrrg, and then she vanished into thin air.
1�I didn't know what to make of it then, but I never thought it would be somethin' big like this.
1�I'm sure that old lady must know what's goin' on.  , I want ya t'travel to the Temple of Uggalepih and find her.
1�And before you go, stop by an' see the Chieftainness in Kazham. If you tell her I sent ya, she may be of some help.
1�No one's going to believe such a crazy story. We're going t'have t'work by ourselves on this one.
1�It may have somethin' t'do with Kam'lanaut's plan.
1�No, Lion. I have another job fer you.
1�Arrrg, I heard from Lion about what happened at Delkfutt's Tower.
1�Our ancient friend called that island floatin' over Qufim ??Tu'Lia??...the Gate of the Gods.
1�What does that boy think he's doing, playing some kind of game with Vana'diel as his prize?
1�Arrrg, a frightenin' place that Zi'Tah be. Ya never know what's gonna creep up behind yer back.
1� , take care when traveling up there, unless ya want to be swimmin' in Davy Jones's locker.
4�Hold on there, missy. You're not going with   this time. I need ya t'travel t'Jeuno and keep an eye on them beastmen.
1�Don't talk back t'me. You know what ya have t'do, now go do it! I'll stay here and watch after me hideout.
1�Arrrg, make sure ya stop by Kazham and visit the Chieftainness, Jakoh Wahcondalo, before heading off t'the Temple of Uggalepih.
1�If ya tell her I sent ya, she should give ya some help. Now get a move on! There's no time t'lose.
1�So we needs 6???? to get deeper into the temple... Even I don't know what lurks down there.
1�I can see potential in you,  , but don't go doin' anything stupid now. We want to sees you back 'ere in one piece!
1�Seven stone monuments? Arrrg, me thinks me saw one in the Yuhtunga or Yhoator Jungle. Can't remember which one, though...
1�And that be all me knows. Maybe ya saw one o' 'em durin' a mission ya went on. Try t'remember. If ya can't, ya can always ask yer adventurin' mateys.
1�I'm sorry that I have no more t'tell ya. If that old bat in the temple hadn't been so secretive...
1�We here at Norg sometimes do business in and around the Sanctuary of Zi'Tah. One big forest, that place is.
1�No, it ain't nothin' like the jungles around here, but it sure be full of surprises. Don't go gettin' caught up in the scenery, or ya may find yourself lost!
1�Arrrg! You've gathered all the jewels! You'd make a mighty fine pirate. No wonder me daughter likes ya. Now all ya have t'do is take those to the ancient temple on Zepwell Island.
1�You'll find Zepwell Island off the southwest tip of Quon. What, you say that's where you found one of the stone monuments? Well, then ya don't need me directions now, do ya?
1�Delkfutt's Tower?I jus' got some information 'bout Verena. If that piece of info is correct, then that tower is where Verena has been taken!
1�And t'make things worse, our Zilart friends from Jeuno seem t'be involved. I've already sent some of me mateys t'help Aldo, but I have a bad feelin' about this. Hurry t'Qufim!
1�Arrrg, if it isn't our little helper ?[boy/girl]!
1�Ya did some mighty fine work in gettin' me matey, Jauc, his materials. Thanks t'you, I got meself a fine new blade.
1�Listen carefully,  . Within a katana, the soul of its maker and the soul of its wielder are intertwined.

1�That newfangled crystal synthesis you adventurers be usin' is all fine fer mantles and arrows, but it can't copy the traditional methods. One must know the essentials behind a blade if they ever want t'master it.
1�That's why we make adventurers like you go on quests like that last one. We want you t'know the true meanin' of wieldin' a blade like this.
1�Know the meaning of the power you hold, and only then will you find the true power within. That be ??bushido,?? the way of the samurai.
1�Yer adventures have already trained you t'become a samurai. Now all that's left is for ya t'pledge your faith t'this blade. Yer power within will do the rest.

1�Rid yerself of all unnecessary thoughts and feel the world around ya. Make yer soul an unclouded mirror...a motionless pond. Project yerself into yer blade. This be the legendary skill used by the samurai--??Meikyo Shisui.??
1�Take this #????,  . This blade was forged fer ya. Pledge your life t'her an' she won't let ya down.
1�Arrrg, so you're the landlubbin' adventurer that they sent from Bastok.
1�I'm a busy man, so let's cut with the chitchat and get right down to business.
1�Lately, you adventurers are making quite a killin' on items, weapons, and the like. We knew that you were out there, but we didn't think you'd be givin' us this much competition.
1�But rather than gettin' in each other's way, I thought that there might be a way we could work together. What I want ya t'do is give me an idea of what you adventurers are capable of.
1�There are a few items that me mateys couldn't acquire. I want ya t'go and get them.
1�Travel to one of them molten lava falls in Ifrit's Cauldron.
1�If you throw in  $????, a monster will appear. Bring back the #???? that the beast has on it.
1�Do ya think you can handle it, ya landlubber?
1�Hah hah hah! Me landlubbin' adventurer brought back  $????. It looks like I need to find myself some new mateys! Hah hah hah!
1�I guess this means you've completed your mission. Now let me write you somethin' you can take back to...
1�Arrrg, why if it ain't little Ayaya. Ya get prettier every time I sees ya.
1�So, what brings ya t'these here parts? Come to check up on your adventurer?
1�If I wanted to snatch up Bastok's best, I'd be snatching up the fine samurai standing in front of me. How about it, Ayaya? Leave that boring job of yours and join us!
1�We'd love t'have you. You'd have the chance t'wield your blade whenever you please, not when that president says you can. Arrrg, what d'ya say?
1�Ayaya...
1�Arrrg, ya don't leave much room fer choice now, do you?
1�Okay, okay. You go back and tell the old president I said hello.Oh, and don't ya forget t'talk to Ryoma before you leave. It's the least ya could do fer him.
1�Arrrg, if it isn't me matey,  . We be mighty grateful fer yer help 'n this one.
1�I'm sure Jauc's already told ya 'bout the upcomin' ritual we be holdin'. We call it ??Yomi Okuri.?? In Far Eastern legend, Yomi is the name of the place where the spirits of the dead roam.
1�Let me explain...
1�Twenty years ago, before the fall of Castle Zvahl and the Shadow Lord, a small country was wiped off the face of Vana'diel by those bloodthirsty beastmen.
1�That country was known as the Marquisate of Tavnazia. The flag we raise here in Norg be the flag of that lost nation.
1�It was a gruesome battle. Citizens of Tavnazia, soldiers from the three nations... Nearly all were slaughtered in a matter of hours.
1�I, too, saw the apocalypse that happened the day Tavnazia fell.When 'twas all over, the handful of us that remained escaped on a tiny ship.
1�But most of me mateys were already in bad shape and didn't survive the long journey home. Only a few of us made it back to Valkurm alive.
1�When we arrived at the dunes, we found that there were others that had tried escapin', but failed...the wreckage of their ships scattered 'bout the beaches.

1�Those who could still move used what remained of their energy to dig simple graves for those that had passed. But this would not be enough to appease the troubled souls that lingered in those sands.
1�Without a guidin' hand, the souls remain in this world, gettin' angrier an' angrier. The Yomi Okuri ritual is held to show these lost spirits the way t'their proper place of restin'.
1�Jauc, you take it from here.
1�An' the only one of me mates that can brew a bait fine enough to make that pecker show its beak would be our head cook, Washu. Get some from her before ya leave.
1�Oh, an' watch yer back in those caves. They be crawlin' with all sorts of terrible beasts. Get it, grab the 3????, and be outta there quick, if ya know what's good fer ya.
1�Arrrg, welcome back,  .Let me fill ya in on the predicament we've got ourselves into.
1�A thief's robbed us of one of our treasures.Me thinks it be another band o'pirates. I've got me men out on the trail of 'em now.
1�Ya may think that problems between pirates should be solved by pirates--and yer right. But this time, the situation's a wee bit more complicated.
1�The item the thief stole was an ancient helmet left by me ancestors called  $????. But this ain't no ordinary helmet.
1�It's said that me father trapped the spirit of an evil demon in that helmet after a grueling battle in the Northlands. He put numerous magical seals on it t'keep the beast at bay.
1�This probably be the reason that our rival pirates decided t'lay their grimy hands on it.
1�T'make a long story short, I need ya t'find the man that had the nerve t'rob me, and get that helmet back. Not too difficult fer an adventurer like you, eh?
1�And if fer some reason, the magic seal on the helmet were to be broken, we'll need ya t'...well, ya know what we'll need ya t'do then.

1�Because of the sensitive nature of this problem, not many here in Norg have been informed of what has happened. However, the men I have sent to track down the thieves should have some good information fer ya, but first ya have t'search them out.
1�Arrrg, I'm sorry fer gettin' ya caught up in our pirate affairs, but I be mighty glad t'see ya back here safe in Norrrg.
1�You have me thanks fer all ya done for us.
1�If it weren't fer ya, we'd still be fearin' the day that demon would rear its ugly head 'n eat us all. But now that the demon's gone, that just leaves a pretty helmet t'sit on me wall.
1�But what good is a helmet without a head t'wear it!? This #???? would do you more good than it would collectin' dust in me chambers. Take it! You've earned it!
1�Arrrg, so ya say ya couldn't journey deeper into the temple because a grate was blockin' yer way?
1�What? Ya saw a stairway on the other side of that bloomin' grate? Ha! Leave it t'the Zilart t'build somethin' crazy like that.
1�But this ain't no time fer complainin'. We've got t'figger out a way t'get t'that stairway.
1�There's got t'be some way t'open that wall. Some kind of key...
1�Arrrg! I've got it!Ya say the Zilarrrt used crystals t'power their strange machines, right? Then maybe...
1�I think me may know the way t'get through that grate.
1�Listen up,  . I want ya t'find a Mithra named Mary or Maroo or somethin' like that. She was in Norg a while back, but now she could be anywhere on the mainlands.
1�Why all this trouble over a cat? Well, when that lady was here, she tried sellin' us a strange crystal she said she found in the Sanctuary of Zi'Tah.
1�I don't think she was tryin' t'pull a fast one, but no one was interested in her booty, so she packed up and left fer somewhere else.
1�But now that me thinks of it, that crystal she found in Zi'Tah may be jus' what we're lookin' fer.
1�A thief like her won't be easy t'find. I'll have me mateys around Vana'diel spread the word that yer lookin' fer a crystal like the one she has.
1�If she gets wind of that info, that Maree's likely t'settle down until ya find her. We can only pray that what she has is what we need.
1�Arrrg, so that be the 3???? that we've been searchin' fer. It looks like you had a hell of a time tryin' t'get yer hands on it.
1�But the real hell is yet t'come,  . Crystal Warriors...floating islands... It may all seem crazy, but don't let that get in yer way. Yer Vana'diel's only hope.
1�Arrrg, so were ya able t'make it t'Tu'Lia?
1�Oh, so ya made them Crystal Warriors walk the plank now, did ya? Then that jus' leaves us with that wee prince. But first, we've got t'find a way into the darn shrine.
1�Is it Eald'narrrche that's keepin' us out, or is it somethin' else?
1�Listen close,  .
1�If the prince had already opened the Gate of the Gods, Vana'diel wouldn't be here anymore. But as you can see, nothin's changed so far.
1�Which means all we can do is wait. When Eald'narche makes his move...that's when we attack!
1�You'n me both hate the Zilarrrt makin' fools out of us, but there's nothing much we can do right now.
1�We can't know when Eald'narche will attempt t'open the gate. It could be t'morrow, fer all I know. If ya have any preparations, I'd suggest makin' 'em now.
1�Arrrg, I see you made it back safe 'n sound.
1�Yer story won't be goin' down in the annals of history, but there are some things that best go unknown.
1�Though if it wasn't fer you, we'd all be sleepin' down in Davy Jones's locker. Ya have me thanks, matey.
1�As fer Lion... Aldo came and gave me all the details on what she did.
1�What was she thinkin', goin' off and gettin' herself killed before her own father...
1�She washed up on shore here when she was still just a wee lass. Nobody knew where she came from...
1�But that wasn't uncommon during the Great War. Many a life was torn apart back then.
1�And when me father told me I was t'take care of her...well, I can tell ya, I wasn't ready fer that.
1�But raisin' Lion taught me a lot about the world. If it wasn't fer her, I wouldn't be the man I be today.
1�I never knew what she thought about her father bein' a pirate...
1�But I can tell you one thing--I be mighty damn proud to have her as a daughter.
1�Arrrg, the Zilarrrt's dream of Paradise may be over, but that doesn't change the fact that them beastmen still be crawlin' over the face of Vana'diel.
1�When ya think about it, this little charade with the princes may've just been the tip of the blimey iceberg.
1�And Lion... I haven't told the other scallywags what really happened t'her. They all think she's off on some adventure...

1�It's always easier t'forget about the things that trouble ya. That be why people always forget those who pass away. I don't want that happenin' t'me daughter. That's why she'll always be alive here in Norg.
1�Arrg, be good to see ya!So you and yer friends were the landlubbers what saved her, eh?
1�Don't ya worry none, she be sleepin' it off like a sailor that's too fond of Opo-opo brew. The whole ordeal's left me girl a bit under the weather, but she'll pull through.
1�Hasn't stopped her talkin' me ears off, o'course. Can't get a word in edgewise.
1�...I jus' be glad that me girl ain't forgotten about me.
1�Even after walkin' the plank into the great beyond, she still remembers her old man.
1�She may not be me daughter by blood, but she's still the apple of me eye. I do believe a reward be due you.
1�Ya can have the pick of one of me treasures. I'll be givin' whatever's left to yer mates what helped ya.
1�Blimey. Are ya tryin' t'tell me that the savior of the world can't make up ?[his/her] mind about a simple thing like this? Guess some things never change, eh?
1�But who be I t'judge?Let me know when you've made yer decision.Jus' don't complain if all the best loot be taken!
1�? $????.That's what ya want?
1�Here.That be a treasure unlike any you'll ever see again.Don't go losin' it over the side of no stinkin' ferry!
1�By me bleedin' eyepatch, I can't be handing over any booty when yer bag be full of flotsam and jetsam. You heroes need to learn a thing o' two about organization!

1�Here.That be a treasure unlike any you'll ever see again.Don't go losin' it over the side of no stinkin' ferry!

1�By me bleedin' eyepatch, I can't be handing over any booty when yer bag be full of flotsam and jetsam. You heroes need to learn a thing o' two about organization!
1�Arrg, I almost be forgettin'. Me girl wants ya to pummel some beastie that's been hauntin' her dreams. Stuff o' nightmares, she says.
1�Don't make much sense to me, but I be guessin' you know the truth of it. If ya ever need an old pirate's help, ya just let me know.
1�Fer a girl what's saved the world, it be an endearin' thing fer her to be afraid of her dreams.
1�Don't make much sense to me, but I be guessin' you know the truth of it. If ya ever need an old pirate's help, ya just let me know.
1�Arrg, so you've made a decision?
1�Blimey. Are ya tryin' t'tell me that the savior of the world can't make up ?[his/her] mind about a simple thing like this? Guess some things never change, eh?

1�By me bleedin' eyepatch, I can't be handing over any booty when yer bag be full of flotsam and jetsam. You heroes need to learn a thing o' two about organization!

1�By me bleedin' eyepatch, I can't be handing over any booty when yer bag be full of flotsam and jetsam. You heroes need to learn a thing o' two about organization!
1�? $????.That's what ya want?
1�Here.That be a treasure unlike any you'll ever see again.Don't go losin' it over the side of no stinkin' ferry!
1�By me bleedin' eyepatch, I can't be handing over any booty when yer bag be full of flotsam and jetsam. You heroes need to learn a thing o' two about organization!
1�Ahoy,  ! 'Tis good to see yer hale 'n hearty, matey.

1�I didn't want t' burden ye wit' another one of me infamous ramblings, but what kind of captain would I be if I sent me crew to sea wit' nary a jib nor oar?Just bite the bollard fer a bit and I'll be done as quick as possible...but I can't promise nothin', fer when ye've spent as much time twixt mast n' main as me, time starts t' mean somethin' else entirely.
1�Ye'll next be shovin' off fer ??Sky.?? Aye, that's right. Tu'Lia be yer destination.

1�This ain't no Bibiki Bay or Buburimu Peninsula--hardly a soul knows 'bout this ethereal archipelago.To make matters worse, ev'ryone in ports across Vana'diel be gettin' their timbers shivered over some unseen scourge. And I'd be willin' t' wager ye all the gil in Norg that Jeuno knows somethin' 'bout this we don't.

1�Burst me barnacles! If I didn't know better, I'd swear this was nothin' more'n the ramblings of some blunder'n boatswain.Arrrg, gone are the days when we pirates were the worst of the world's ills, matey.

1�Still, we seem t' both be steerin' ourrr ships t'wards the same ??X?? on the proverbial treasure map fer the time bein'...Yet seein' how our plans be wide as the horiz'n, we best not turn a patched eye to these problems.

1�Keep this infermation below deck, if ye catch me drift. The situation be bad enough without the entire continent up in arms.In any case, I'll make sure t' apprrrise ye of any new developments if I get wind of 'em. Ye can count on that--cross me own plank and hope t' fly, stick a pegleg on me thigh.

1�I fergot to mention somethin'! Yer still hoardin' that 3????, ain'tcha?I think it's s'pposed to hatch or whatnot if'n ye raise it right. I ain't too sure on the partic'lars, though.Best ye check wit' me first mate Kieran on that.

1�He knows the rest of the aft flotation--arrrg, I mean apt infermation. Maybe I truly do have a family of crows roostin' in me ol' crow's nest.May that stone serve ye well in yer travels, though, as ye may very well be the realm's only hope.
1�Lastly, don't do anything out there a salty sea dog like meself wouldn't do, matey.

1�Still, we seem t' both be steerin' ourrr ships t'wards the same ??X?? on the proverbial treasure map fer the time bein'...Yet seein' how our plans be wide as the horiz'n, we best not turn a patched eye to these problems.

1�Keep this infermation below deck, if ye catch me drift. The situation be bad enough without the entire continent up in arms.In any case, I'll make sure t' apprrrise ye of any new developments if I get wind of 'em. Ye can count on that--cross me own plank and hope t' fly, stick a pegleg on me thigh.
1�First, thank ye fer doin' what needs be done. Me heart, it be waterlogged with guilt fer always makin' ye perform these underwater operations.
1�Yet ye be the only one I can trust. Wit' all these lily-livered deckhands in me service--none be fit to hold a sword, if ye ask me.

1�...Which makes it all the worse t' tell ye that we be gettin' drenched in this Voidwalker squall, and we be takin' on water faster'n we can bail it out. We still don't know much 'bout this perfect storm o' sorts either, which I find queerer than a cryin' kraken.
1�The westerly winds bring wit' 'em tales of destruction from the Near East as well.
1�Sadly, me hands be tied and I haven't the time t' drop down no dinghies fer ourrr neighbors to the east.
1�Which is why I be sendin' ye. I figured ye'd be hoistin' sail and shovin' off soon as ye heard this anyway, and that fire in yer belly be what we need most right now.
1�The violence be spreadin' like Selbina butter on bread, and no matter how many fiends ye slay, thar be no end t' 'em.We ain't got the foggiest idea what be goin' on.

1�Ye be the ballast that keeps Vana'diel upright,  , and the realm needs ye now mor'n ever. This may not be worth a grain of salt, comin' from an old sailor tucked safely away in his captain's quarters, but don't go overboard wit' the heroics.
1�The westerly winds bring wit' 'em tales of destruction from the Near East as well.

1�Ye be the ballast that keeps Vana'diel upright,  , and the realm needs ye now mor'n ever. This may not be worth a grain of salt, comin' from an old sailor tucked safely away in his captain's quarters, but don't go overboard wit' the heroics.
1�Oho! Would ya look who's decided ta join us!
1�Ya got krill in yer ears, ?[boy/girl]? She's callin' you her master!
1�What kind of master runs around fergettin' who their pupils are?6Ya mean to say ya don't remember her at all?
1�What's all this malarkey?
1�Did ya hit yer head 'fore I found ya floating adrift or somethin'?
1�Then how'd ya get here?
1�And from that outfit yer wearing, I'd wager ya were born in the Far East.
1�Oho. I know the particulars of the eastern faith are a bit foreign ta the rest of us, but Altana remains a central figure even there.

1�Atmacite is best described as the crystalline agglomeration of a creature's soul.Our scientists have succeeded in discovering a way to tap its power to serve the efforts of the Voidwatch.
1�By infusing one's body with atmacite, it is possible to obtain powers akin to those once possessed by the creature whence it came, rather like turning a beast's fangs upon its own kind.
1�At first glance, atmacite appears to be the perfect artificial enhancement. However, it does suffer from a single limitation: its power is unleashed only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.
1�Research to identify the exact reason for this continues, but most scientists find the spectral alignment theory compelling.
1�That is, being formed of Voidwalker souls, atmacite will surge to life only when its bearer is existentially aligned to its dimension of origin.
1�From this it can be inferred that Voidwalkers are stripped of considerable strength when they cross over into Vana'diel.
1�But I suspect this is of little interest to a layman like you. Allow me to return to the subject at hand.
1�The infusion of atmacite requires cruor, a potent energy source that takes the form of shiny red granules.
1�Cruor is obtainable by various means, felling a Voidwalker being the most common of all.As you can never have too much cruor, I urge you to be diligent in its procurement.
1�We've recently perfected a method for improving atmacite potency. The process is called enrichment, and involves fusing cruor on to atmacite to amplify its power.

1�Atmacite can be enriched in stages up to a maximum of level 
�. The quantity of cruor required varies with the variety of atmacite as well as its current enrichment level.

1�Under normal conditions, atmacite enrichment is an intensive process that demands trained hands.For reasons yet to be determined, however, both infusion and enrichment can be safely performed by laymen, provided they're at a planar rift.
1�Keep this in mind should the need arise to reconfigure your atmacite with haste.
